name: Barbara Dunin-Keplicz
content: Barbara Dunin-Kêplicz Barbara Dunin-Kêplicz home page Home Research Publications Grants Teaching Cooperation Group Barbara Dunin-Kêplicz is a Professor of computer science at the Institute of Informatics of Warsaw University and at the Institute of Computer Science of the Polish Academy of Sciences. She obtained her Ph.D. in 1990 on computational linguistics from the Jagiellonian University, and in 2004 she was awarded her habilitation on formal methods in multi-agent systems from the Polish Academy of Sciences.She is an expert in multi-agent systems. She was one of the pioneers of modeling BDI systems, recently introducing approximate reasoning to the agent-based approach. Postal address: Institute of Informatics University of Warsaw Banacha 2 02-097 Warsaw Poland E-mail: keplicz "at" mimuw.edu.pl Phone: +48 22 55 444 32 Fax: +48 22 55 444 00 © 2010 Barbara Dunin-Kêplicz.
